metadata.title: Two ‘human traffickers’ nabbed from Gwadar - Pakistan - DAWN.COM

content.article_body: GWADAR: Police have arrested two suspects involved in human trafficking sending people abroad through illegal land and sea routes. Officials said that they were arrested on the information about their involvement in facilitating the illegal transport of Pakistani nationals from Punjab and other areas of the country to Europe via the Makran and Iran route, after receiving millions of rupees. Acting on the directives of the DIG Makran Pervez Umrani, SSP Gwadar Zia Mandokhel leading a team of police officers has conducted a successful raid in the Padi Zar area of Gwadar and arrested the suspects. They were identified as Khalid Noor Mohammad, a resident of Pishikan (local agent), and Murad Allah Wala, a resident of Rahim Yar Khan, Punjab. After initial investigation, they were handed over to Federal Investigation Agency (FIA), Gwadar, officials for further legal proceedings. Published in Dawn, January 15th, 2025
